attributes.action: Allow consumer choice about where goods they are buying are made
attributes.additional_details: Consumers need to be able to make informed choices.  At present, it is not possible, when Internet or catalogue shopping, to know where goods are made. We need to be able to decide if we wish to boycott buying from certain countries and, by doing so, encourage the support of British industry.
attributes.background: Introduce legislation that makes it obligatory for goods sold through the Internet or catalogues to show where they are made.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:
All products sold in the UK to be clearly labelled with country of origin:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309019

Make Internet sellers list goods' country of origin:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317819

Country Of Origin Labelling should be compulsory on all imported food:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325067
